Basic details: John Doe, a 28-year-old male, walks into the ED after a motor vehicle accident.
Vitals:
BP: 120/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.7°F (37.1°C)
RR: 20/minute
HR: 100/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting upright on the bed, holding his left arm and grimacing in pain.
Exhibit signs of anxiety and restlessness.
Occasionally winces when asked to move his arm or shoulder.
If asked about his injuries, respond, 'I think my arm is broken.'
Challenging question: "Do I have any internal injuries? Will I need surgery?"
